Madhuri Dixit Feels The Biggest Pressure While Taking Kalank Was To Not Let Sridevi Down
You surely would be living under a rock if you're unaware of the fact that Sridevi was originally roped in for the role of Bahaar Begum in Dharma's ambitious project, Kalank. But due to unfortunate and untimely demise of the veteran actress, Karan passed on the role to Madhuri Dixit.
Just to jog your memory a little, Sridevi's daughter and actress Janhvi Kapoor even thanked Madhuri for accepting the role.
And now, after the release of the first look of Bahaar Begum, Madhuri opened up about the role. Speaking to Mid-day about stepping into a role that was originally supposed to be played by Sridevi, Madhuri said, “I don’t want to let her down.”
Instagram
Also, after the first look was revealed, a lot of people on social media got reminded of her character in Bhansali's Devdas as Chandramukhi. In the same interview, Madhuri close to put an end to all such comparisons. She said,

“Bahaar Begum is poles apart from Chandramukhi or anything I have done before. It was a challenge to play her with grace and heart.”
The first look of several characters of Kalank were unveiled on March 8 and for Madhuri's character, KJo wrote: “Enchanting, ethereal & timeless. The true ‘Begum’ of hearts, Bahaar!”
